com.std.model.pattern

Class DayOfWeekPattern

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.std.model.pattern.RecurrencePattern
      • com.std.model.pattern.DayOfWeekPattern
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class DayOfWeekPattern
extends RecurrencePattern
    This class is the representation of a pattern that would exist on certain days of the week. If the user would like an appointment to exist several times a week then this is the class that would deal with it
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DayOfWeekPattern

        public DayOfWeekPattern(DateRange r,
                boolean[] days)
        creates a new DayOfWeekPattern
        Parameters:
        r - date range of the occurrence pattern
        days - of the week to occur on. the indices of the array correspond to the days of the week constants in the Calendar class:

        boolean[] days = new boolean[7];
        days[Calendar.SUNDAY] = true;
        days[Calendar.SATURDAY] = true;
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if days is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length of days is not 7

    • Method Detail

      • setDays

        public void setDays(boolean[] days)
        sets the days of the week to occur on.
        Parameters:
        days - days of the week to occur on. the indices of the array correspond to the days of the week constants in the Calendar class:

        boolean[] days = new boolean[7];
        days[Calendar.SUNDAY] = true;
        days[Calendar.SATURDAY] = true;
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - if days is null
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the length of days is not 7
